Submodules

autoop.core.ml.model.model module

class autoop.core.ml.model.model.Model[source]

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for the fit and predict methods.

ModelObject = ~Model
add_parameters(key: str, value: ndarray | list[str] | StandardScaler) → None[source]

Adds or updates a single parameter in the model’s parameters.

Parameters:

  • key (str) – The name of the parameter to add or update.

  • value (Any) – The value of the parameter.

fit(observations: ndarray, ground_truth: ndarray) → None[source]

Fit the model to the provided observations and ground truth.

Parameters:

  • observations (np.ndarray) – An array of training data

  • ground_truth (np.ndarray) – An array of labels for the training data

property parameters: Dict[str, ndarray]

Retrieves the model’s parameters as a dictionary.

Returns:

A deep copy of the internal dictionary containing the model’s parameters.

Return type:

Dict[str, np.ndarray]

predict(observations: ndarray) → ndarray[source]

Predict the output based on the input observations.

Parameters:

observations (np.ndarray) – An array of data for prediction.

Returns:

An array of predicted values.

Return type:

np.ndarray

property type: str

Returns the type of the model.

Module contents

This module provides a function to retrieve machine learning model instances by name.

autoop.core.ml.model.get_model(model_name: str) → Model[source]

Factory function to get a model by name.
